name: CloudFoundry
description: Push your applications to Cloud Foundry
author: Microsoft

inputs.name: cfEndpoint
inputs.label: Cloud Foundry Endpoint
inputs.helpMarkDown: Service endpoint for your Cloud Foundry instance.

inputs.name: skipSSLValidation
inputs.label: Skip SSL Validation
inputs.helpMarkDown: Skip SSL validation when connecting to the Cloud Foundry endpoint.

inputs.name: oneTimePassword
inputs.label: Use One-time Password
inputs.helpMarkDown: Use a one-time password to login to the Cloud Foundry instance.

inputs.name: org
inputs.label: Org
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optionally specify the org to login to on the Cloud Foundry instance. The default org will be used if nothing is specified.

inputs.name: space
inputs.label: Space
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optionally specify the space to login to on the Cloud Foundry instance. The default space will be used if nothing is specified.

inputs.name: cfManifest
inputs.label: Manifest File
inputs.helpMarkDown: The path to the manifest file containing Cloud Foundry deployment options.

inputs.name: name
inputs.label: Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of the application to push to Cloud Foundry.

inputs.name: instances
inputs.label: Instances
inputs.helpMarkDown: Number of instances of the application to deploy.

inputs.name: memoryLimit
inputs.label: Memory Limit
inputs.helpMarkDown: The maximum amount of memory each instance of the pushed application can consume.

inputs.name: startCommand
inputs.label: Start Command
inputs.helpMarkDown: The command that Cloud Foundry uses to start each instance of your application.

inputs.name: domain
inputs.label: Domain
inputs.helpMarkDown: Domain where the application is pushed.

inputs.name: host
inputs.label: Host
inputs.helpMarkDown: Subdomain where the application is pushed.

inputs.name: additionalDeployArgs
inputs.label: Additional Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: Additional arguments to pass to `cf push`. Reference: http://docs.cloudfoundry.org/cf-cli/getting-started.html#push

inputs.name: createServices
inputs.label: Create Services
inputs.helpMarkDown: Choose to create new services before pushing your application.

inputs.name: createServiceArgs
inputs.label: Create Service Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Specify name of user provided service to create with optional properties. Specify each service on a new line e.g. 

 `my-db-service1` 

 `my-route-service -r https://example.com`

inputs.name: bindServices
inputs.label: Bind Services
inputs.helpMarkDown: Choose to bind existing services to your application.

inputs.name: appName
inputs.label: Application Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the name of the application to which to bind services.

inputs.name: bindServiceArgs
inputs.label: Bind Service Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Specify service names with optional service-specific configuration parameters to bind to the application. Specify each service on a new line e.g. 

`my-db-service1` 

 `my-db-service2 -c ~/workspace/tmp/instance_config.json`

inputs.name: workingDirectory
inputs.label: Working Directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: The working directory of the application that should be pushed to Cloud Foundry.

inputs.name: cfToolLocation
inputs.label: Cloud Foundry CLI Location
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optionally specify the location to the cf CLI. If location is not specified, cf CLI needs to be in the PATH.
